question: Question_08_(a)
hints:
Both the Alternating Series Test (AST) and Alternating Series Esimation
Theorem (ASET) \emph{DO NOT} tell you the exact value of an alternating
series. The key word \textbf{evaluate} implies that there should be a
way to find the exact value of the series.

Does the series look like a familiar Maclaurin series of a function
evaluated at a certain point?
